1. Load the data
```{r}
# Load required libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(caret)
library(GGally)
library(factoextra)

# Load the data
df <- read.csv("diabetes_binary_health_indicators_BRFSS2015.csv")
```

2. View structure and summary
```{r}
str(df)               # Structure of the dataset
summary(df)           # Summary statistics
dim(df)               # Dimensions (rows, columns)
```

3. Chekc for missing values
```{r}
colSums(is.na(df))    # Count missing values per column        
```

4. Class Balance (Target Variable)
```{r}
table(df$Diabetes_binary)
prop.table(table(df$Diabetes_binary))

# Plot class balance
ggplot(df, aes(x = factor(Diabetes_binary))) +
  geom_bar(fill = "steelblue") +
  labs(title = "Class Distribution", x = "Diabetes", y = "Count")
     
```

5. Correlation Matrix
```{r}
cor_mat <- cor(df)
round(cor_mat[,"Diabetes_binary"], 2)[order(-abs(cor_mat[,"Diabetes_binary"]))]

# Visualize correlations
ggcorr(df, label = TRUE, label_alpha = TRUE)
               
```

6. PCA for visualisation
```{r}
# Remove target variable
df_features <- df %>% select(-Diabetes_binary)

# Standardize features
df_scaled <- scale(df_features)

# Run PCA
pca_result <- prcomp(df_scaled, center = TRUE, scale. = TRUE)

# Visualize PCA (first 2 components)
fviz_pca_ind(pca_result,
             geom.ind = "point",
             pointshape = 21,
             col.ind = as.factor(df$Diabetes_binary),
             palette = c("#00AFBB", "#FC4E07"),
             legend.title = "Diabetes") +
  labs(title = "PCA - BRFSS Diabetes Indicators")

              
```

7. Distribution Plot
```{r}
# Example: BMI by diabetes status
ggplot(df, aes(x = BMI, fill = factor(Diabetes_binary))) +
  geom_histogram(position = "identity", alpha = 0.5, bins = 30) +
  labs(title = "BMI Distribution by Diabetes Status", x = "BMI", fill = "Diabetes")

# Example: Boxplot of GenHlth
ggplot(df, aes(x = factor(Diabetes_binary), y = GenHlth)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(title = "General Health Score by Diabetes", x = "Diabetes", y = "GenHlth")            
```
